summary: This document is a chain of emails between attorneys from Crowell & Moring LLP and a federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York, coordinating a second proffer interview for their client, Larry Visoski. The emails discuss scheduling and the topics for the interview, which include Mr. Visoski's interactions with a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee named Timothy Routch and any knowledge of Routch's interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.role: Managing Partner, New York Office at Crowell & Moring LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing Larry Visoski. He is the primary correspondent coordinating the scheduling and preparation for Mr. Visoski's proffer interview with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: The individual for whom the attorneys are arranging a proffer interview with the U.S. Attorney's Office. The prosecutors intend to ask him about his interactions with Timothy Routch and Routch's potential interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding the scheduling and preparation for Larry Visoski's proffer interview.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding the scheduling and preparation for Larry Visoski's proffer interview.

persons.name: Josh Morrissey
persons.role: IT staff at Crowell & Moring LLP
persons.context: IT staff member at the law firm who was to be included in a WebEx meeting invitation to ensure technical readiness.

persons.name: Timothy Routch
persons.role: U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee
persons.context: A U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee who worked in Saint Thomas and had Larry Visoski listed as a contact. The U.S. Attorney's Office intends to ask Visoski about the nature and timeline of his interactions with Routch, and any interactions Routch may have had with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation. The U.S. Attorney's Office is interested in any interactions Timothy Routch may have had with him, as part of their inquiry to Larry Visoski.

connections.description: McGorty is an attorney at Crowell & Moring LLP preparing Visoski for a proffer interview with federal prosecutors.
Visoski had Routch listed as a contact in his phone, and federal prosecutors want to understand the nature and timeline of their interactions.
Federal prosecutors are investigating any potential interactions between U.S. Customs employee Routch and Jeffrey Epstein.
Both are attorneys at Crowell & Moring LLP working on the Visoski case.
Both are attorneys at Crowell & Moring LLP working on the Visoski case.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Interview with Larry Visoski
events.description: A scheduled WebEx meeting for a second proffer interview between Larry Visoski (and his attorneys) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Execution of Proffer Agreement
events.description: Glen McGorty sent a signed proffer agreement to the U.S. Attorney's Office, formalizing the terms for Larry Visoski's cooperation interview.

locations: 590 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10022-2524 (Crowell & Moring LLP office)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was conducting a second proffer interview with Larry Visoski in November 2020 as part of the Epstein investigation.
A key line of inquiry was Visoski's relationship with Timothy ('Tim') Routch, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee in Saint Thomas who had Visoski as a contact.
Prosecutors specifically intended to ask Visoski about any interactions Routch may have had with Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence shows active legal coordination and preparation between Visoski's defense team at Crowell & Moring LLP and federal prosecutors.
The emails are marked as privileged attorney-client communication and attorney work product, indicating the sensitive nature of the discussions.
